title: Creating PubMed Data Visualization Dashboards
text: goal pubmedDashboard facilitate creation pretty data visualization dashboards using flexdashboard easyPubMed packages.

title: Creating PubMed Data Visualization Dashboards
text: can install development version pubmedDashboard like :

title: Creating PubMed Data Visualization Dashboards
text: pubmedDashboard helps parse address identify department university affiliation, well country.
code: library(pubmedDashboard)  address <- c("Department of Psychology, Cornell University, Ithaca, New York 14853-7601.",              "Dipartimento di Psicologia Generale, Università di Padova, Italy.",              "Universität Mannheim, Federal Republic of Germany.",              "Département de psychologie, Université du Québec à Montréal.")  get_affiliation(address, "department") #> [1] "Department of Psychology"            "Dipartimento di Psicologia Generale" #> [3] NA                                    "Département de psychologie"  get_affiliation(address, "university") #> [1] "Cornell University"              "Università di Padova"            #> [3] "Universität Mannheim"            "Université du Québec à Montréal"  get_country(address) #> [1] "United States" "Italy"         "Germany"       NA

title: Creating PubMed Data Visualization Dashboards
text: One simple function allows download paper data PubMed, convert XLM data dataframe, extract affiliations, match universities countries, identify countries continents, save file disk later reuse.
code: pubmed_query_string <- paste(   "passion [Title/Abstract]",   "OR Dualistic Model of Passion [Text Word]")  save_process_pubmed_batch(   pubmed_query_string,   year_low = 2023,   year_high = 2030) #> 1/5 - Downloading PubMed data... #> [1] "PubMed data batch 1 / 1 downloaded..." #> 2/5 - Converting XLM files to dataframe... #> 3/5 - Extracting affiliations... #> 4/5 - Matching universities to countries... #> 5/5 - Identifying countries and continents... #> Operation sucessfully completed. Congratulations!  #> File saved in data/articles_2023_2030.rds
